newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso ends up on overnight rates hike.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso ends up on overnight rates hike.

text.p: * Volume slips to $96.5 million from $151 million
The Philippine peso ended higher at 26.228 to a U.S. dollar on Wednesday from the previous 26.254 after the Central Bank raised its overnight rates.
"The peso rose after the Central Bank brought up its overnight borrowing rate to 12.5 percent," said one trader.
Total volume dropped to $96.5 million from $151 million, as the peso moved between a high of 26.227 and a low of 26.243.
Dealers say they expect the value of the peso to stay at current high levels unless the Central Bank brings down overnight rates in the next few days.
The Central Bank had raised its overnight rates for two consecutive sessions to curb speculation in the foreign exchange market following the steep fall of treasury bill rates on Monday.
